blocks.value: The Seraphim are the highest order of angels, closest to God's throne. Their name means 'the burning ones,' reflecting their intense love and adoration for God.

In Isaiah's vision (Isaiah 6:2-3), the Seraphim are described as having six wings: with two they cover their faces, with two they cover their feet, and with two they fly. They continuously cry out 'Holy, Holy, Holy is the Lord of Hosts!'
The Seraphim exist in perpetual worship and adoration of God. Their burning love purifies and inflames the hearts of those lower in the heavenly hierarchy, spreading divine love throughout creation.
